original_title: Micromanipulator Touches The Tiny Things, Cheaply
original_content:
Some things are small and fragile enough that they cannot be held or touched by even the steadiest of hands. Such cases call for a micromanipulator, and [BYU CMR]s DIY micromanipulator design can be 3D printed and assembled with the help of some common hardware, and a little CA glue.
You may recall an ultra-tiny Nerf-like blaster recently; clearly such a tiny mechanical device cannot be handled directly, yet needed to be loaded and have its trigger pressed. A micromanipulator is exactly the tool for such a job. This design is in fact the very same one used to move and manipulate that tiny blaster at a microscopic level.
The design doesnt include any end effectors  those depend on ones application  but there is a mount point for them and the manipulator can effectively move it in X, Y, and Z axes by turning three different knobs. In addition, because the structural parts can be 3D printed and the hardware is just some common nuts and screws, its remarkably economical which is always a welcome thing for a workshop.
title: DIY 3Dプリントマイクロマニピュレーターを作ろう！
body: BYU CMRのDIYマイクロマニピュレータは、3Dプリントと共通のハードウェア、そして少しのCA接着剤を使って作成できます。このデザインは、超小型のメカニカルデバイスを操作するためのツールです。3つのノブを回すことで、X、Y、Z軸で効果的に移動できます。
